content: nuki - 貫 - designed by kineco yarn urth monokrom dk 100g / 274m / 100% merino wool col 6063 1240m / 450g needles 3 6mm / jp5 circular needle 3 3mm / jp4 circular needle 3 0mm / jp3 circular needle gauge 24 sts and 30 row = 10cm in st st with 3 6mm/jp5 needle 16 sts and 32 row = 7cm and 10cm in main pattern see page6 with 3 6mm/jp5 needle notions stitch markers holders cable needle crochet hook for crocheted provisional cast-on nuki -貫- features a pattern inspired by nuki joinery scrap yarn for crocheted provisional cast-on a traditional japanese architectural technique it is worked seamlessly from the top down begin working flat then join under the armholes and continue in the round 1 / 10 measurements abbreviations r row/round rs right side a ws wrong side co cast on b bobble bind off bor beginning of round f c st s stitch es e repeat bef before g m a/b marker a/b d pm a/b place marker a/b sm slip marker a 50cm c 21cm e 54cm g 7cm k knit b 19cm d 10cm f 37cm p purl all measurements are taken flat tbl through back loop finished body circumference approximately 108cm k2to knit 2 stitches together ssk slip slip knit 2 sts together through back loop instruction for yoke m1r make 1 stitch knit right leaning stitch m1pr make 1 stitch purl right leaning stitch m1l make 1 stitch knit left leaning stitch front sec 4 m1pl make 1 stitch purl left leaning stitch front 56sts co22sts 56sts yoke mds make double stitch kds knit double stitch sec 2 left pds purl double stitch 44sts front 44sts sec 3 1/1 rt sl1 to cable needle hold in back k1 right k1 from cable needle co134sts front sec 1 1/1 lt sl1 to cable needle hold in front k1 back k1 from cable needle yoke back 2 / 10 sec 1 back yoke use 3 6mm/jp5 circular needle use 3 6mm/jp5 circular needle and work back yoke flat setup with rs facing place the leftmost 44 sts on the needle setup1 rs co134 using crocheted provisional cast-on the remaining 90 sts on the holder setup2 ws k1 p1 tbl k1 p40 pma p48 pmb p40 k1 p1 tbl k1 consist of 46 neck sts and 44 right front sts start german short row join yarn and work left front flat r1-14 work r1-14 of back shoulders chart flat see page 7 r1-24 work r1-24 of left front chart flat see page 8 > work short row beginning r1 rs at ma and r2 ws at mb > 12 sts increased 56 sts total maintaining main pattern > remove the markers after the first short row on each side break yarn and place 56 sts for left front on a holder > work short row every 7 sts 6 times on each side > at the end 8 repeats of main pattern will have
